subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Paranormal Investigation Into 2012 Via Ghost Box 	EVP Part 2
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
Was this posted here already?

http://www.nasa.gov/topics/earth/features/2012-guest.html

Zack


On Fri, Mar 26, 2010 at 3:26 PM, neferkit <Neferkit@verizon.net> wrote:

>
>
> Since most of the 2012 doomsday prophecies focus on the Mayan calendar, I
> thought I'd chimed in. I'm 1/2 Cherokee and have a PhD in Ethnic Studies
> with a specialization in Native American Studies. I know many Maya people
> and have studied their mythology and culture. I hate to break anyone's
> doomsday bubbles, but the Mayan calendar did not end with the date Dec. 21,
> 2012. That was the end date on one stellae. There are many others that go
> beyond that date, including one that goes well into the 4000s. Plus, there
> are many contemporary Maya daykeepers who continue working on the calendar.
> So, to those using the Mayan calendar as a prophetic compass, I really
> wouldn't worry about the world coming to an end in 2012. Please don't take
> this post as pompous snottiness on my part. I see a lot of fear out there
> about 2012 and I'm just trying to alleviate that.
>
> Pat
>
>
